definition: powder/cosmetic face powder/food prepared from starch/noodles or pasta made from any kind of flour/whitewash/white/pink
to brush/to paint/to daub/to paste up/to skip class (of students)/to fire from a job

sentences.english: You won't dignify the house just by painting it.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅通過粉刷房子不會給房子增添光彩。

sentences.english: Repainting the room has really made an improvement.
sentences.chinese: 重新粉刷確實令房間大有改善。

sentences.english: A fresh coat of paint transformed the room.
sentences.chinese: 房間粉刷一遍大爲改觀。

sentences.english: The railings on this side have just been whitewashed and can fade easily.
sentences.chinese: 這邊的扶手纔剛粉刷過，很容易掉色。

sentences.english: We are going to get our house repainted.
sentences.chinese: 我們打算找人將房子重新粉刷。

sentences.english: I suppose we could do the painting and wallpapering.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們可以粉刷一下並貼上壁紙。

sentences.english: One New Jersey man decided to paint the exterior of his house to save money.
sentences.chinese: 新澤西有位仁兄爲了省錢，決定自己粉刷屋子的外牆。

sentences.english: I'ii have my little house whitewashed tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我找人用石灰水粉刷一下小屋。

sentences.english: It's hard to white-wash the huge wall.
sentences.chinese: 粉刷這面大牆是很難的。

sentences.english: The fence gets white-washed every year.
Last year I summoned up the courage to paint them.
sentences.chinese: 去年我鼓起勇氣把它們全體粉刷了。

sentences.english: Wearing overalls on weekdays, painting somebody else's house to earn money?
sentences.chinese: 平日穿着工作服靠幫別人粉刷房子賺錢？

sentences.english: Some others were whitewashing a house.
sentences.chinese: 另外一些農民正在粉刷一所房子。

sentences.english: It was constructed from prefabricated wood trusses and pre-finished metal panels.
sentences.chinese: 整體結構使用預製木桁架和預粉刷的金屬板材。

sentences.english: Water-retention rate is one of important properties for stucco gypsum.
sentences.chinese: 分析了影響粉刷石膏保水率的相關因素和測試條件。

sentences.english: He suggested he should entirely repaint the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他建議重新把整個樓梯粉刷，多花不了多少。

definition: to point a brick wall/to grout a tiled surface
to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
to plaster/to render (a wall)/(fig.) to bring shame on/also pr. [mo4 hui1]
to build by laying bricks or stones
to revamp/a face-lift/to retread (a tire)/to refurbish (old clothes)/newly emerging
to apply paint, veneer etc/to plaster over/decorative coating/finish/veneer
